definition: to reach great heights (in technical skills or scholastic achievements)

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
(of a mountain) high and tapered peak or summit/mountain-like in appearance/highest level/classifier for camels
old variant of 峰[feng1]
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
extremely/pole (geography, physics)/utmost/top

sentences.english: Barro's anti-Keynesianism is at the extreme end.
sentences.chinese: 巴罗的反凯恩斯观点登峰造极。

sentences.english: Deception Point is pulse-pounding fiction at its best.
sentences.chinese: 《大骗局》是让脉搏狂飙的登峰造极之作。

sentences.english: Today, the society is highly developed and the level of disguise also reaches a peak.
sentences.chinese: 时至今日，社会文明高度发达，伪饰也达到登峰造极。

sentences.english: This political pressure came to a head over the weekend in Reykjavik's parliament.
sentences.chinese: 这种政治压力在上周末的冰岛议会上登峰造极。

definition: lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement
to surpass all others of its kind before and since/to have neither predecessors nor successors
pinyin: qian2 wu2 gu3 ren2 hou4 wu2 lai2 zhe3

definition: peak/pinnacle/ultimate
excellent/superlative
variant of 巔峰|巅峰[dian1 feng1]
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
(idiom) brilliant/extremely skillful/virtuosic
skillful/proficient
level of mastery (of a skill or area of knowledge)/(archaic) to pay a visit to sb
unsurpassed/extreme/extraordinary
consummate/exquisite
skill/art
refined/profound
summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
in the extreme (idiom)/incapable of further increase
